newsitem.title: USA: FOB Gulf Grain - Corn, soy and wheat values rise.
newsitem.headline: FOB Gulf Grain - Corn, soy and wheat values rise.

text.p: U.S. Gulf FOB corn, soybean and soft red winter wheat basis values were mostly higher amid ideas incoming frigid weather will slow river movement, grain dealers said.
Grain and soybean sales normally slow near Christmas, and frigid weather would likely reduce sales further, they said.

Algeria was reported to be seeking 100,000 tonnes of wheat this week and India 500,000 tonnes. U.S. exporters said for price and freight reasons, Algeria will likely buy Argentinian or French wheat. However, they said a small portion of the India business could be U.S. white wheat.
CORN (No. 3 yellow, FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu) -
January unq + H nc unq + H nc
February unq + H nc +44 + H up 4
March unq + H nc +37 + H up 1
SOYBEANS (No. 2 yellow, FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu)
Dec unq unq unq + F nc
SRW WHEAT (FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu) -
HRW WHEAT (FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis KCBT, cts/bu) -
